segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drive uses the rapid encryption that is provided by BitLocker Drive Encryption to enhance data security and management.
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drive uses the rapid encryption that is provided by BitLocker Drive Encryption to enhance data security and management.

segment.source: By offloading the cryptographic operations to hardware, Encrypted Hard Drives increase BitLocker performance and reduce CPU usage and power consumption.
segment.target: By offloading the cryptographic operations to hardware, Encrypted Hard Drives increase BitLocker performance and reduce CPU usage and power consumption.

segment.source: Because Encrypted Hard Drives encrypt data quickly, enterprise devices can expand BitLocker deployment with minimal impact on productivity.
segment.target: Because Encrypted Hard Drives encrypt data quickly, enterprise devices can expand BitLocker deployment with minimal impact on productivity.

segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drives are a new class of hard drives that are self-encrypting at a hardware level and allow for full disk hardware encryption.
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drives are a new class of hard drives that are self-encrypting at a hardware level and allow for full disk hardware encryption.

segment.source: In Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, and later you can install to these devices without additional modification.
segment.target: In Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, and later you can install to these devices without additional modification.

segment.source: Some of the benefits of Encrypted Hard Drives include:
segment.target: Some of the benefits of Encrypted Hard Drives include:

segment.source: Better performance: Encryption hardware, integrated into the drive controller, allows the drive to operate at full data rate with no performance degradation.
segment.target: Better performance: Encryption hardware, integrated into the drive controller, allows the drive to operate at full data rate with no performance degradation.

segment.source: Strong security based in hardware: Encryption is always "on" and the keys for encryption never leave the hard drive.
segment.target: Strong security based in hardware: Encryption is always "on" and the keys for encryption never leave the hard drive.

segment.source: User authentication is performed by the drive before it will unlock, independently of the operating system
segment.target: User authentication is performed by the drive before it will unlock, independently of the operating system

segment.source: Ease of use: Encryption is transparent to the user because it is on by default.
segment.target: Ease of use: Encryption is transparent to the user because it is on by default.

segment.source: There is no user interaction needed to enable encryption.
segment.target: There is no user interaction needed to enable encryption.

segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drives are easily erased using on-board encryption key; there is no need to re-encrypt data on the drive.
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drives are easily erased using on-board encryption key; there is no need to re-encrypt data on the drive.

segment.source: Lower cost of ownership: There is no need for new infrastructure to manage encryption keys, since BitLocker leverages your Active Directory Domain Services infrastructure to store recovery information.
segment.target: Lower cost of ownership: There is no need for new infrastructure to manage encryption keys, since BitLocker leverages your Active Directory Domain Services infrastructure to store recovery information.

segment.source: Your device operates more efficiently because processor cycles do not need to be used for the encryption process.
segment.target: Your device operates more efficiently because processor cycles do not need to be used for the encryption process.

segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drives are supported natively in the operating system through the following mechanisms:
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drives are supported natively in the operating system through the following mechanisms:

segment.source: Identification: The operating system can identify that the drive is an Encrypted Hard Drive device type
segment.target: Identification: The operating system can identify that the drive is an Encrypted Hard Drive device type

segment.source: Activation: The operating system disk management utility can activate, create and map volumes to ranges/bands as appropriate
segment.target: Activation: The operating system disk management utility can activate, create and map volumes to ranges/bands as appropriate

segment.source: Configuration: The operating system can create and map volumes to ranges/bands as appropriate
segment.target: Configuration: The operating system can create and map volumes to ranges/bands as appropriate

segment.source: API: API support for applications to manage Encrypted Hard Drives independently of BitLocker Drive Encryption (BDE)
segment.target: API: API support for applications to manage Encrypted Hard Drives independently of BitLocker Drive Encryption (BDE)

segment.source: BitLocker support: Integration with the BitLocker Control Panel provides a seamless BitLocker end user experience.
segment.target: BitLocker support: Integration with the BitLocker Control Panel provides a seamless BitLocker end user experience.

segment.source: Warning: Self-Encrypting Hard Drives and Encrypted Hard Drives for Windows are not the same type of device.
segment.target: Warning: Self-Encrypting Hard Drives and Encrypted Hard Drives for Windows are not the same type of device.

segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drives for Windows require compliance for specific TCG protocols as well as IEEE 1667 compliance; Self-Encrypting Hard Drives do not have these requirements.
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drives for Windows require compliance for specific TCG protocols as well as IEEE 1667 compliance; Self-Encrypting Hard Drives do not have these requirements.

segment.source: It is important to confirm the device type is an Encrypted Hard Drive for Windows when planning for deployment.
segment.target: It is important to confirm the device type is an Encrypted Hard Drive for Windows when planning for deployment.

segment.source: If you are a storage device vendor who is looking for more info on how to implement Encrypted Hard Drive, see the Encrypted Hard Drive Device Guide.
segment.target: If you are a storage device vendor who is looking for more info on how to implement Encrypted Hard Drive, see the Encrypted Hard Drive Device Guide.

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: To use Encrypted Hard Drive, the following system requirements apply:
segment.target: To use Encrypted Hard Drive, the following system requirements apply:

segment.source: For Encrypted Hard Drives used as data drives:
segment.target: For Encrypted Hard Drives used as data drives:

segment.source: The drive must be in an uninitialized state.
segment.target: The drive must be in an uninitialized state.

segment.source: The drive must be in a security inactive state.
segment.target: The drive must be in a security inactive state.

segment.source: For Encrypted Hard Drives used as startup drives:
segment.target: For Encrypted Hard Drives used as startup drives:

segment.source: The drive must be in an uninitialized state.
segment.target: The drive must be in an uninitialized state.

segment.source: The drive must be in a security inactive state.
segment.target: The drive must be in a security inactive state.

segment.source: The computer must be UEFI 2.3.1 based and have the EFISTORAGESECURITYCOMMANDPROTOCOL defined.
segment.target: The computer must be UEFI 2.3.1 based and have the EFISTORAGESECURITYCOMMANDPROTOCOL defined.

segment.source: (This protocol is used to allow programs running in the EFI boot services environment to send security protocol commands to the drive).
segment.target: (This protocol is used to allow programs running in the EFI boot services environment to send security protocol commands to the drive).

segment.source: The computer must have the Compatibility Support Module (CSM) disabled in UEFI.
segment.target: The computer must have the Compatibility Support Module (CSM) disabled in UEFI.

segment.source: The computer must always boot natively from UEFI.
segment.target: The computer must always boot natively from UEFI.

segment.source: Warning: All Encrypted Hard Drives must be attached to non-RAID controllers to function properly.
segment.target: Warning: All Encrypted Hard Drives must be attached to non-RAID controllers to function properly.

segment.source: Technical overview
segment.target: Technical overview

segment.source: Rapid encryption in BitLocker directly addresses the security needs of enterprises while offering significantly improved performance.
segment.target: Rapid encryption in BitLocker directly addresses the security needs of enterprises while offering significantly improved performance.

segment.source: In versions of Windows earlier than Windows Server 2012, BitLocker required a two-step process to complete read/write requests.
segment.target: In versions of Windows earlier than Windows Server 2012, BitLocker required a two-step process to complete read/write requests.

segment.source: In Windows Server 2012, Windows 8, or later, Encrypted Hard Drives offload the cryptographic operations to the drive controller for much greater efficiency.
segment.target: In Windows Server 2012, Windows 8, or later, Encrypted Hard Drives offload the cryptographic operations to the drive controller for much greater efficiency.

segment.source: When the operating system an Encrypted Hard Drive, it activates the security mode.
segment.target: When the operating system an Encrypted Hard Drive, it activates the security mode.

segment.source: This activation lets the drive controller generate a media key for every volume that the host computer creates.
segment.target: This activation lets the drive controller generate a media key for every volume that the host computer creates.

segment.source: This media key, which is never exposed outside the disk, is used to rapidly encrypt or decrypt every byte of data that is sent or received from the disk.
segment.target: This media key, which is never exposed outside the disk, is used to rapidly encrypt or decrypt every byte of data that is sent or received from the disk.

segment.source: Configuring Encrypted Hard Drives as Startup drives
segment.target: Configuring Encrypted Hard Drives as Startup drives

segment.source: Configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives as startup drives is done using the same methods as standard hard drives.
segment.target: Configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives as startup drives is done using the same methods as standard hard drives.

segment.source: These methods include:
segment.target: These methods include:

segment.source: Deploy from media: Configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives happens automatically through the installation process.
segment.target: Deploy from media: Configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives happens automatically through the installation process.

segment.source: Deploy from network: This deployment method involves booting a Windows PE environment and using imaging tools to apply a Windows image from a network share.
segment.target: Deploy from network: This deployment method involves booting a Windows PE environment and using imaging tools to apply a Windows image from a network share.

segment.source: Using this method, the Enhanced Storage optional component needs to be included in the Windows PE image.
segment.target: Using this method, the Enhanced Storage optional component needs to be included in the Windows PE image.

segment.source: You can enable this component using Server Manager, Windows PowerShell, or the DISM command line tool.
segment.target: You can enable this component using Server Manager, Windows PowerShell, or the DISM command line tool.

segment.source: If this component is not present, configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives will not work.
segment.target: If this component is not present, configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives will not work.

segment.source: Deploy from server: This deployment method involves PXE booting a client with Encrypted Hard Drives present.
segment.target: Deploy from server: This deployment method involves PXE booting a client with Encrypted Hard Drives present.

segment.source: Configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives happens automatically in this environment when the Enhanced Storage component is added to the PXE boot image.
segment.target: Configuration of Encrypted Hard Drives happens automatically in this environment when the Enhanced Storage component is added to the PXE boot image.

segment.source: During deployment, the TCGSecurityActivationDisabled setting in unattend.xml controls the encryption behavior of Encrypted Hard Drives.
segment.target: During deployment, the TCGSecurityActivationDisabled setting in unattend.xml controls the encryption behavior of Encrypted Hard Drives.

segment.source: Disk Duplication: This deployment method involves use of a previously configured device and disk duplication tools to apply a Windows image to an Encrypted Hard Drive.
segment.target: Disk Duplication: This deployment method involves use of a previously configured device and disk duplication tools to apply a Windows image to an Encrypted Hard Drive.

segment.source: Disks must be partitioned using at least Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012 for this configuration to work.
segment.target: Disks must be partitioned using at least Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012 for this configuration to work.

segment.source: Images made using disk duplicators will not work.
segment.target: Images made using disk duplicators will not work.

segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drive Architecture
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drive Architecture

segment.source: Encrypted Hard Drives utilize two encryption keys on the device to control the locking and unlocking of data on the drive.
segment.target: Encrypted Hard Drives utilize two encryption keys on the device to control the locking and unlocking of data on the drive.

segment.source: These are the Data Encryption Key (DEK) and the Authentication Key (AK).
segment.target: These are the Data Encryption Key (DEK) and the Authentication Key (AK).

segment.source: The Data Encryption Key is the key used to encrypt all of the data on the drive.
segment.target: The Data Encryption Key is the key used to encrypt all of the data on the drive.

segment.source: The drive generates the DEK and it never leaves the device.
segment.target: The drive generates the DEK and it never leaves the device.

segment.source: It is stored in an encrypted format at a random location on the drive.
segment.target: It is stored in an encrypted format at a random location on the drive.

segment.source: If the DEK is changed or erased, data encrypted using the DEK is irrecoverable.
segment.target: If the DEK is changed or erased, data encrypted using the DEK is irrecoverable.

segment.source: The Authentication Key is the key used to unlock data on the drive.
segment.target: The Authentication Key is the key used to unlock data on the drive.

segment.source: A hash of the key is stored on drive and requires confirmation to decrypt the DEK.
segment.target: A hash of the key is stored on drive and requires confirmation to decrypt the DEK.

segment.source: When a computer with an Encrypted Hard Drive is in a powered off state, the drive locks automatically.
segment.target: When a computer with an Encrypted Hard Drive is in a powered off state, the drive locks automatically.

segment.source: As a computer powers on, the device remains in a locked state and is only unlocked after the Authentication Key decrypts the Data Encryption Key.
segment.target: As a computer powers on, the device remains in a locked state and is only unlocked after the Authentication Key decrypts the Data Encryption Key.

segment.source: Once the Authentication Key decrypts the Data Encryption Key, read-write operations can take place on the device.
segment.target: Once the Authentication Key decrypts the Data Encryption Key, read-write operations can take place on the device.

segment.source: When writing data to the drive, it passes through an encryption engine before the write operation completes.
segment.target: When writing data to the drive, it passes through an encryption engine before the write operation completes.

segment.source: Likewise, reading data from the drive requires the encryption engine to decrypt the data before passing that data back to the user.
segment.target: Likewise, reading data from the drive requires the encryption engine to decrypt the data before passing that data back to the user.

segment.source: In the event that the DEK needs to be changed or erased, the data on the drive does not need to be re-encrypted.
segment.target: In the event that the DEK needs to be changed or erased, the data on the drive does not need to be re-encrypted.

segment.source: A new Authentication Key needs to be created and it will re-encrypt the DEK.
segment.target: A new Authentication Key needs to be created and it will re-encrypt the DEK.

segment.source: Once completed, the DEK can now be unlocked using the new AK and read-writes to the volume can continue.
segment.target: Once completed, the DEK can now be unlocked using the new AK and read-writes to the volume can continue.

segment.source: Initialize the disk and select the appropriate partition style (MBR or GPT)
segment.target: Initialize the disk and select the appropriate partition style (MBR or GPT)
